domains.description:
This domain exposes CSS read/write operations. All CSS objects (stylesheets, rules, and styles)
have an associated `id` used in subsequent operations on the related object. Each object type has
a specific `id` structure, and those are not interchangeable between objects of different kinds.
CSS objects can be loaded using the `get*ForNode()` calls (which accept a DOM node id). A client
can also keep track of stylesheets via the `styleSheetAdded`/`styleSheetRemoved` events and
subsequently load the required stylesheet contents using the `getStyleSheet[Text]()` methods.

domains.description:
This domain exposes DOM read/write operations. Each DOM Node is represented with its mirror object that has an `id`. This `id` can be used to get additional information on the Node, resolve it into the JavaScript object wrapper, etc. It is important that client receives DOM events only for the nodes that are known to the client. Backend keeps track of the nodes that were sent to the client and never sends the same node twice. It is client's responsibility to collect information about the nodes that were sent to the client.

Note that `iframe` owner elements will return corresponding document elements as their child nodes.

commands.name: beginFrame

parameters.name: frameTime
parameters.description:
Timestamp of this BeginFrame (milliseconds since epoch). If not set, the current time will
be used unless frameTicks is specified.

parameters.name: frameTimeTicks
parameters.description:
Timestamp of this BeginFrame in Renderer TimeTicks (milliseconds of uptime). If not set,
the current time will be used unless frameTime is specified.

parameters.name: deadline
parameters.description:
Deadline of this BeginFrame (milliseconds since epoch). If not set, the deadline will be
calculated from the frameTime and interval unless deadlineTicks is specified.

parameters.name: deadlineTicks
parameters.description:
Deadline of this BeginFrame in Renderer TimeTicks  (milliseconds of uptime). If not set,
the deadline will be calculated from the frameTime and interval unless deadline is specified.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description:
The interval between BeginFrames that is reported to the compositor, in milliseconds.
Defaults to a 60 frames/second interval, i.e. about 16.666 milliseconds.

parameters.name: noDisplayUpdates
parameters.description:
Whether updates should not be committed and drawn onto the display. False by default. If
true, only side effects of the BeginFrame will be run, such as layout and animations, but
any visual updates may not be visible on the display or in screenshots.

parameters.name: screenshot
parameters.description:
If set, a screenshot of the frame will be captured and returned in the response. Otherwise,
no screenshot will be captured. Note that capturing a screenshot can fail, for example,
during renderer initialization. In such a case, no screenshot data will be returned.

commands.description:
Sends a BeginFrame to the target and returns when the frame was completed. Optionally captures a
screenshot from the resulting frame. Requires that the target was created with enabled
BeginFrameControl. Designed for use with --run-all-compositor-stages-before-draw, see also
https://goo.gl/3zHXhB for more background.

set in response to an authChallenge.

authChallenge.

authChallenge.

commands.name: continueInterceptedRequest

modifications, or blocks it, or completes it with the provided response bytes. If a network
fetch occurs as a result which encounters a redirect an additional Network.requestIntercepted
event will be sent with the same InterceptionId.

domains.description:
Runtime domain exposes JavaScript runtime by means of remote evaluation and mirror objects.
Evaluation results are returned as mirror object that expose object type, string representation
and unique identifier that can be used for further object reference. Original objects are
maintained in memory unless they are either explicitly released or are released along with the
other objects in their object group.

types.description:
Primitive value which cannot be JSON-stringified. Includes values `-0`, `NaN`, `Infinity`,
`-Infinity`, and bigint literals.

properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for `object` type values only.

properties.name: className
properties.description: Object class (constructor) name. Specified for `object` type values only.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Remote object value in case of primitive values or JSON values (if it was requested).

properties.name: unserializableValue
properties.description:
Primitive value which can not be JSON-stringified does not have `value`, but gets this
property.

properties.name: preview
properties.description: Preview containing abbreviated property values. Specified for `object` type values only.

types.description: Mirror object referencing original JavaScript object.

properties.description:
A function which serves as a getter for the property, or `undefined` if there is no getter
(accessor descriptors only).

properties.name: set
properties.description:
A function which serves as a setter for the property, or `undefined` if there is no setter
(accessor descriptors only).

properties.name: configurable
properties.description:
True if the type of this property descriptor may be changed and if the property may be
deleted from the corresponding object.

properties.name: enumerable
properties.description:
True if this property shows up during enumeration of the properties on the corresponding
object.

properties.name: wasThrown
properties.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

properties.name: isOwn
properties.description: True if the property is owned for the object.

properties.name: symbol

properties.description: The value associated with the property.

Represents function call argument. Either remote object id `objectId`, primitive `value`,
unserializable primitive value or neither of (for undefined) them should be specified.

allows to track cross-debugger calls. See `Runtime.StackTrace` and `Debugger.paused` for usages.
